body.p: To his excellency Thos E Bramlet Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky your petitioner James Estep was fined at the present December Term (1865) for one act of retailing Liquor $20 -- he says it was an inditement long before the War and he says that he was fined for the same offense ^before^ -- he says he is poor -- been was a soldier in the Federal service for near three and Honorable discharge -- He asks pardon or remission for the same
we unite in the prayer of Jas Estep above we think it is right we Know he was a soldier as stated & a poor man
